meanings.definition: The use of missiles as weapons.
meanings.sent1: The military base focused on improving its missilery to enhance defense capabilities.
meanings.sent2: The country invested heavily in missilery to protect its borders.
meanings.sent3: During the war games, the soldiers joked about the importance of good missilery for victory.
meanings.sent4: The missilery of the navy struck fear into the enemy forces.
meanings.sent5: The demonstration showcased the destructive power of advanced missilery.

meanings.definition: The act of launching or firing missiles.
meanings.sent1: The missilery of the air force was swift and precise.
meanings.sent2: The commander ordered the missilery to commence as soon as the enemy was in range.
meanings.sent3: The technicians practiced the missilery drills to ensure readiness at all times.
meanings.sent4: The missilery of the battleship echoed across the sea.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous sound of missilery filled the air during the exercise.

meanings.definition: The study or development of missiles.
meanings.sent1: The university offered a course in missilery for aspiring engineers.
meanings.sent2: The research facility was at the forefront of missilery advancements.
meanings.sent3: The scientists discussed the latest breakthroughs in missilery technology.
meanings.sent4: The laboratory was dedicated to the innovation of missilery systems.
meanings.sent5: The conference focused on the future of missilery research.
